comments: His Zen Buddhism class was inspirational. He is very knowledgeable about Zen history, practice and philosophy. He also has his own personal meditation experience and knows how to translate its theory into practice. He is friendly and interesting.
I have taken two courses with him and like his teaching style. He is a nice and kind professor. He is eager to help me find my Div II focus, and I am very grateful for his help.

I really enjoyed the class and Ryan knows what he\'s talking about. However, he\'s not a very good advisor and he hasn\'t really helped guide me through the DIV process at all, which is a bit frustrating.
Ryan does a lot for his own students. I am his advisee and quite happy actually.

I had two courses with him in his first year at hampshire. At this point, his facilitation and presentation skills need improvement to make class time effective. However, his genuine desire to teach was evident and he was always willing to meet or talk after class.
so I did not think ryan was good at all but i guess i am going against the grain here- there was alot of awkaward silences and he didnt know how to inspire students about the material at all
Decoding Zen Buddhism class was very enlightening truly. Ryan is good.
He is a good and interesting teacher. He is very enthusiastic and helpful. I would recommend his Buddhism and Society class.
Theories of Religions course was challenging but very rewarding at the end. He is a good teacher.
Buddhism in Society class was awesome. I learned so much. Thanks Ryan and Sue!!!

Intro to Chinese Religions course was quite good. I did not know what to expect at the beginning. But, Ryan introduced his students to wide variety of Daoist, Buddhist, Confucian texts, rituals and practices. I came away with pretty solid understanding of Chinese religions and history. He is quite flexible and willing to help.

This course (Buddhism during the colonial period) was one of the best classes that I have ever taken at Hampshire. The course was inspiring and interesting at the same time. Ryan was very helpful and kind. He also made us think very critically about the category of religion in general and contemporary Buddhist ideas in particular.

I took his class on Studying Buddhism through Material Objects. I really enjoyed this class and got much more than I expected. Ryan is a great teacher. He was always well prepared, enthusiastic and caring for his students. Chanting exercise, youtube video clips, and creative group project were also excellent. I would recommend his class to anyone.

Ryan is a very sweet person but not the best teacher. He severely avoids answering questions esp. if they\'re controversial. He seems to know most of the material but he rushes through it when teaching & doesn\'t explain the components of Buddhism well enough. He is not too helpful as an adviser either. but as a person, generally adorable & caring
